pageContext.desc: On his arrival at Panama and intention to leave for San Francisco.
pageContext.category: Everett D. Graff Collection of Western Americana; U.S. Western Expansion; Letters (Correspondence)

pages.transcription:
Hon John M Read              Panama Feby 6th 1849
Dear Friend
I have only time to
to advise of the safe arrival of myself &
lady to this place and of having had
the pleasure of meeting Genl Smith?
the day before his departure.  I again
thank you for your kind letter.  I refer
you to circular herewith -- You will observe
I have taken the liberty of adding to the list of respectable names
obscured.  I leave in a few days
obscured Barque John Ritson -- some 250
passengers must await an opportunity--
vessels are expected? hourly.  I hope
to arrive at San Francisco within thirty
days.  I have written a voluntary
letter for Mr Bennett -- if published
it will be signed by me.  I refer you
to same--
Your Obt S
Wm Cornell Jewett

Panama Feb 6/49
Hon John M. Read
Philadelphia

pageContext.title: William Cornell Jewett letter to John M. Read, 1849
